s.text: It may be easier to change your e-mail address than your street address, but for a lot of us, we'd probably have to tell more people about the former than the latter.
What was striking about the attack on AOL, though, was just how obvious and devoid of new information it was.
What was striking about the attack on AOL, though, was just how obvious and devoid of new information it was.
What was striking about the attack on AOL, though, was just how obvious and devoid of new information it was.
What was striking about the attack on AOL, though, was just how obvious and devoid of new information it was.
What was striking about the attack on AOL, though, was just how obvious and devoid of new information it was.
Now, there's nothing wrong with quoting short-sellers on companies, even when they stand to make a great deal of money if their comments knock those companies' stock prices down.
But the drop in AOL's price was noteworthy because it seems to have been provoked almost entirely by a negative item on the company that appeared in Barron's over the weekend.

We were also told that AOL was already suffering, and would suffer more in the future, from price cuts on the part of its American competitors, and that soon the company would have to rescind the price hike it was able to push through last year.
